CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The UV - vis absorption spectra of PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) measured in chlorobenzene at different temperatures and in thin films are shown in Figure 1.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
|--------------|
| PffBB-n       |
| PffBB-10      |
| PffBB-12      |
| PffBB-14      |
| PffBB-16      |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
|--------------|
| PffBB-n       |
| PffBB-10      |
| PffBB-12      |
| PffBB-14      |
| PffBB-16      |

Explanation:

The paragraph mentions "PffBB-n" several times, where n can take the values 10, 12, 14, or 16. These are the different forms or variants of the material PffBB. Therefore, they are valid material names. The other mentioned entities, such as "UV-vis absorption spectra", "chlorobenzene", "different temperatures", and "thin films", do not clearly refer to material names and should be excluded from the table.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The UV - vis absorption spectra of PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) measured in chlorobenzene at different temperatures and in thin films are shown in Figure 1.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| UV-vis absorption spectra |
| of PffBB-n |
| (n = 10, 12, 14, or 16) |
| measured |
| in chlorobenzene |
| at different temperatures |
| in thin films |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| UV-vis absorption spectra of PffBB-n |
| (n = 10, 12, 14, or 16) |
| measured in chlorobenzane |
| at different temperatures |
| in thin films |

Note: I assumed "chlorobenzene" is a type of solvent, but since it is mentioned in relation to the measurement of a material property (UV-vis absorption spectra), I kept it in the table. If "chlorobenzene" is not considered a material property, it can be removed from the table.
